text:
1. Every system has a specific purpose.
  2. System must have one component.
  3. There is a relationship and interaction between the components forming the system.
Which of the above is/are among the properties of system?
explanation:
-
These properties of system can be listed as follows:
• Every system has a specific purpose. The purpose underlines the fact that system has at least one function.
• System has more than one component (part, element)
• There is a relationship and interaction between the components forming the system
• Components form a whole. Here, whole is not used in the meaning of “monolith” or “uniform” but in the meaning of “formation” which fulfills a specific function with the help of the components.

text: Which of the below is defined as the area separating the boundaries of two systems?
explanation:
-
System is a collection of conceptual or physical components that are brought together to reach one or more specific purpose or conclusion. The boundary of system must firstly be set to be able to determine the system. Everything stays out of the system constitutes the environment of system. The system boundary is a field separating the system from its environment. Another concept related with the system is system interface. It is defined as the area separating the boundaries of two systems. System interface is the platform that an output of a system is transported to another system or the point of contact which system components connect with the environment or each other.
The system which has not got any interaction with its environment or other systems in the environment is termed as closed system.
Inflows to the open system from environment or elements exported during interaction with environment are named input. In contrast, outflows from open system to the environment or imported elements are termed output.
